<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
public static void writeToFile (String filename) throws IOException {
    PrintWriter outputWriter = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter("scores.txt"));
    System.out.println("Please enter 10 scores.");
    System.out.println("You must hit enter after you enter each score.");
    Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
    int score = 0;
    while (score <= 10) {
        int val = sc.nextInt();
        if (val < 0) break;
        outputWriter.write(val + "\n");
        score++;
    }
    outputWriter.flush();
    outputWriter.close();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are using BufferedWriter.write(int c) which writes a single character to the output stream. But you need to write a string representation of the integer followed by a newline. So, you should use PrintWriter.write(String s) which writes a string to the output stream. Also, you need to add a newline ("\n") after each score to ensure that each score is written on a new line.
